snippet: While in Cairo, taking in a neighborhood seminar on how a Constitution works.
abstract: Carol Giacomo Editorial Observer holds that the most hopeful sign of a burgeoning democracy in Egypt is the political enthusiasm of many young Egyptians, noting that some are holding seminars at night in Cairo neighborhoods on the role of a Constitution in a democracy.
lead_paragraph: While in Cairo, taking in a neighborhood seminar on how a Constitution works.

headline.print_headline: Despite the Army’s Obstruction, Egyptians Work to Build a Democracy
